They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".

They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".

They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".

They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorou

It took a lot of scientists and people with old wisdom to unlock this hidden power and the secrets behind it. They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected

It took a lot of scientists and people with old wisdom to unlock this hidden power and the secrets behind it. They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. It took a lot of scientists and people with old wisdom to unlock this hidden power and the secrets behind it. They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it wo

The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked.

They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked.

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. 

It took a lot of scientists and people with old wisdom to unlock this hidden power and the secrets behind it. They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdraw

After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today

They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they h

They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowi

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. 

It took a lot of scientists and people with old wisdom to unlock this hidden power and the secrets behind it. They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked.

The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked.

After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told.  These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. 

It took a lot of scientists and people with old wisdom to unlock this hidden power and the secrets behind it. They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked.

Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. 

It took a lot of scientists and people with old wisdom to unlock this hidden power and the secrets behind it. They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked.

They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of hu

The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told.  These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more ac

They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. 

It took a lot of scientists and people with old wisdom to unlock this hidden power and the secrets behind it. They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unlaoding their mana

 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana.

After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana.

People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana.

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. 

It took a lot of scientists and people with old wisdom to unlock this hidden power and the secrets behind it. They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana.

Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana. 

The warriors would learn how to cast powerful and ancient spells at their training camp that would be able to kill the aliens with relative ease. Once a g

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. 

It took a lot of scientists and people with old wisdom to unlock this hidden power and the secrets behind it. They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana.

The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana. 

The warriors would learn how to cast powerful and ancient spells at their training camp that would be able to kill the aliens with relative ease. Once the warriors began to be dispersed

The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana.

People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana.

After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana. 

The warriors would learn how to cast powerful and ancient spells at their training camp that would be able to kill the aliens with relative ease. Once the warriors began to be dispersed around the world to fight the threat,

Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana. 

The warriors would learn how to cast powerful and ancient spells at their training camp that would be able to kill the aliens with relative ease. Once the warriors began to be dispersed around the world to fight the threat, the tides began to t

They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana. 

The warriors would learn how to cast powerful and ancient spells at their training camp that would be able to kill the aliens with relative ease. Once the warriors began to be dispersed around the world to fight the threat, the tides began to turn in the humans' f

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. 

It took a lot of scientists and people with old wisdom to unlock this hidden power and the secrets behind it. They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked.

 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana. 

The warriors would learn how to cast powerful and ancient spells at their training camp that would be able to kill the aliens with relative ease. Once the warriors began to be dispersed around the world to fight the threat, the tides began to turn in the humans' favor. They stood no chance against

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. 

It took a lot of scientists and people with old wisdom to unlock this hidden power and the secrets behind it. They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana. 

The warriors would learn how to cast powerful and ancient spells at their training camp that would be able to kill the aliens with relative ease. Once the warriors began to be dispersed around the world to fight the threat, the tides began to turn in the humans' favor. They stood no chance against the power of the War

Once the warriors began to be dispersed around the world to fight the threat, the tides began to turn in the humans' favor. They stood no chance against the power of the Warriors.

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. 

It took a lot of scientists and people with old wisdom to unlock this hidden power and the secrets behind it. They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana. 

The warriors would learn how to cast powerful and ancient spells at their training camp that would be able to kill the aliens with relative ease. Once the warriors began to be dispersed around the world to fight the threat, the tides began to turn in the humans' favor. They stood no chance against the power of the Warriors.

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. 

It took a lot of scientists and people with old wisdom to unlock this hidden power and the secrets behind it. They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana. 

The warriors would learn how to cast powerful and ancient spells at their training camp that would be able to kill the aliens with relative ease. Once the warriors began to be dispersed around the world to fight the threat, the tides began to turn in the humans' favor. They stood no chance against the power of the Warriors.

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. 

It took a lot of scientists and people with old wisdom to unlock this hidden power and the secrets behind it. They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana. 

The warriors would learn how to cast powerful and ancient spells at their training camp that would be able to kill the aliens with relative ease. Once the warriors began to be dispersed around the world to fight the threat, the tides began to turn in the humans' favor. They stood no chance against the power of the Warriors.

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. 

It took a lot of scientists and people with old wisdom to unlock this hidden power and the secrets behind it. They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana. 

The warriors would learn how to cast powerful and ancient spells at their training camp that would be able to kill the aliens with relative ease. Once the warriors began to be dispersed around the world to fight the threat, the tides began to turn in the humans' favor. They stood no chance against the power of the Warriors.

There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana. 

The warriors would learn how to cast powerful and ancient spells at their training camp that would be able to kill the aliens with relative ease. Once the warriors began to be dispersed around the world to fight the threat, the tides began to turn in the humans' favor. They stood no chance against the power of the Warriors.

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. 

It took a lot of scientists and people with old wisdom to unlock this hidden power and the secrets behind it. They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked.

The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana. 

The warriors would learn how to cast powerful and ancient spells at their training camp that would be able to kill the aliens with relative ease. Once the warriors began to be dispersed around the world to fight the threat, the tides began to turn in the humans' favor. They stood no chance against the power of the Warriors.

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. 

It took a lot of scientists and people with old wisdom to unlock this hidden power and the secrets behind it. They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana. 

The warriors would learn how to cast powerful and ancient spells at their training camp that would be able to kill the aliens with relative ease. Once the warriors began to be dispersed around the world to fight the threat, the tides began to turn in the humans' favor. They stood no chance against the power of the Warriors. 

After a few hard fought years, the aleisn were totally driven off of the planet and the human race was saved.

After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana. 

The warriors would learn how to cast powerful and ancient spells at their training camp that would be able to kill the aliens with relative ease. Once the warriors began to be dispersed around the world to fight the threat, the tides began to turn in the humans' favor. They stood no chance against the power of the Warriors. 

After a few hard fought years, the aleisn were totally driven off of the planet and the human race was saved. the Wa

After a few hard fought years, the aleisn were totally driven off of the planet and the human race was saved. the Warriors around

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. 

It took a lot of scientists and people with old wisdom to unlock this hidden power and the secrets behind it. They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana. 

The warriors would learn how to cast powerful and ancient spells at their training camp that would be able to kill the aliens with relative ease. Once the warriors began to be dispersed around the world to fight the threat, the tides began to turn in the humans' favor. They stood no chance against the power of the Warriors.

Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana. 

The warriors would learn how to cast powerful and ancient spells at their training camp that would be able to kill the aliens with relative ease. Once the warriors began to be dispersed around the world to fight the threat, the tides began to turn in the humans' favor. They stood no chance against the power of the Warriors. 

After a few hard fought years, the aliens were totally driven off of the planet and the human race was saved. the Warriors around the world w

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. 

It took a lot of scientists and people with old wisdom to unlock this hidden power and the secrets behind it. They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana. 

The warriors would learn how to cast powerful and ancient spells at their training camp that would be able to kill the aliens with relative ease. Once the warriors began to be dispersed around the world to fight the threat, the tides began to turn in the humans' favor. They stood no chance against the power of the Warriors. 

After a few hard fought years, the aliens were totally driven off of the planet and the human race was saved. the Warriors around the world were hailed as hero

It took a lot of scientists and people with old wisdom to unlock this hidden power and the secrets behind it. They figured out that while yes, the mana is spread very thinly, if people work together they can channel their mana power together, creating an amount large enough to allow someone to wield it and its incredible power. 
The Mana-users are called "Mana-Senshi", which literally translates to "Mana Warrior".
 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana. 

The warriors would learn how to cast powerful and ancient spells at their training camp that would be able to kill the aliens with relative ease. Once the warriors began to be dispersed around the world to fight the threat, the tides began to turn in the humans' favor. They stood no chance against the power of the Warriors. 

After a few hard fought years, the aliens were totally driven off of the planet and the human race was saved. the Warriors around the world were hailed as heroes, and most o

 These warriors were chosen by a council of world leaders to wield the mana and use it against the alien invaders. Once they were selected, getting them their mana was simple; regular citizens from different areas would go to what was called a "Mana Dispensary" and unload their mana in some solution in a vial, which was combined with other vials until there was a canister large enough to administer to a Warrior through IV. The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana. 

The warriors would learn how to cast powerful and ancient spells at their training camp that would be able to kill the aliens with relative ease. Once the warriors began to be dispersed around the world to fight the threat, the tides began to turn in the humans' favor. They stood no chance against the power of the Warriors. 

After a few hard fought years, the aliens were totally driven off of the planet and the human race was saved. the Warriors around the world were hailed as heroes, and most of them returned t

The canister was then taken to the Warrior, who would then be infused with the mana. After being infused, the Warrior would go to a rigorous training camp to learn how to weld their new power along with the other elected Warriors. they were taught by some old sages who knew the ins and outs of mana and how it worked. 

At first, the regular citizens were apprehensive to go to these facilities and get their mana withdrawn from them. Up until today, no one even knew they had this kind of power flowing through them. People also did not trust the government and what they were being told. There were many protests and riots in the streets, but the government was able to quell them by promising that the Warriors would be used for good and it the only hope to fight the aliens. It wasn't until an attack by the aliens that killed thousands of humans happened that people became more accepting of the idea of unloading their mana. 

The warriors would learn how to cast powerful and ancient spells at their training camp that would be able to kill the aliens with relative ease. Once the warriors began to be dispersed around the world to fight the threat, the tides began to turn in the humans' favor. They stood no chance against the power of the Warriors. 

After a few hard fought years, the aliens were totally driven off of the planet and the human race was saved. the Warriors around the world were hailed as heroes, and most of them returned their mana to
